newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber ends down on absence of demand.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber ends down on absence of demand.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices ended lower after the market drifted without buying interest and leads, traders said.
At the close, July RSS1 buyer was quoted by the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board at 285 Malaysian/Singapore cents ($1.13) a kg, down 1.50 cents from Monday.
The board quoted July SMR20 buyer down 0.5 cents at 267.50.
Traders priced the SMR 20 at 263, SMR CV at 333, SMR L at 309, SMR 10 at 264 and drum latex at 228.
"There were no reports of any inquiries or sales, but we might see something tomorrow," said an official trade source.
The INRO five-day average ended at 215.52 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg on June 2 against 214.75 on May 30. The daily indicator was at 216.93 against 215.81.
A Malaysia-based shipping agent quoted freight rates for rubber from Malaysia to Rotterdam at $800 per TEU (or 20-ft container), and $1,700 per two-TEU containers (or 40-ft container).
